question_text: Select two reasons to use private address networking for a virtual machine.
answer_options: To allow the VM to receive external IP addresses
To isolate a secure VM from external communication
To restrict a VM to host-only or internal traffic
To improve DNS resolution for the host system
correct_answer: To isolate a secure VM from external communication
To restrict a VM to host-only or internal traffic
explanation: Private addressing provides network isolation by ensuring that VM traffic stays internal unless explicitly routed.
